BS Office Administration
B. PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION
IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. The extension projects and
activities serve varied clientele

The Campus Extension projects caters diverse groups/communities residing within General
Trias City, Cavite. These are composed of women, youth sectors, children, LGU partners and students from the campus who are interested to participate in all activities.

BS Office Administration
B. PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION
IMPLEMENTATION
I.7. Periodic monitoring and
evaluation of extension
projects and activities are
conducted.

All extension projects are
regularly monitored.
There are submissions of
quarterly reports to the
University Extension Unit.
Submissions were usually done by uploading in
University Extension Unit
google drive (current
mode) or via emails.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.8. Results of monitoring and
evaluation are disseminated
and discussed with
concerned stakeholders

BS Office Administration
B. PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, MONITORING
AND EVALUATION
IMPLEMENTATION
I.9. Re-planning of activities
based on feedback is
conducted.

There was always good feedback in all extension
services provided, however,
bigger and conducive
venues were requested.

All our venues for training
were already held in our
events room in the campus.
With the absence of face-to-
face transactions, seminars
are made online.

BS Office Administration

IMPLEMENTATION
I.9. Accomplishment and
terminal reports are filed and
submitted on time

BS Office Administration
B. PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION
OUTCOMES
O.2. The extension program
has contributed on the
improvement on the quality
of life of the target
clientele/beneficiaries
Some highlight comments received from the webinar.
Some highlight comments received from the webinar.

OVERALL SUMMARY EVALUATION RESULT:
58% (110 out of 188) of the participants who attended the webinar were
highly satisfied with the overall organization of the webinar. 39% (74 out of 188) expressed a moderate satisfaction on the service rendered and the rest were undecided.
Some attendees commented that the webinar was relevant and timely during this pandemic situation.

The extension program of the
BSOA just started to commence
this year. So, the impact on the
beneficiaries will still yet to be
documented.
